name: Group
comment:
A Group is a subclass of standard javascript [`Array`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array). It should only contain Pt instances. You can think of it as an array of Float32Arrays.
See [Group guide](../guide/Group-0300.html) for details.

signatures.comment: Create a Group by passing an array of [`Pt`](#link). You may also create a Group using [`Group.fromArray`](#link) or [`Group.fromPtArray`](#link).

parameters.name: args
parameters.comment: an array of Pts

accessors.name: p1
accessors.comment: The first Pt in this Group

accessors.name: p2
accessors.comment: The second Pt in this Group

accessors.name: p3
accessors.comment: The third Pt in this Group

accessors.name: p4
accessors.comment: The forth Pt in this Group

accessors.name: q1
accessors.comment: The last Pt in this Group

accessors.name: q2
accessors.comment: The second-last Pt in this Group

accessors.name: q3
accessors.comment: The third-last Pt in this Group

accessors.name: q4
accessors.comment: The forth-last Pt in this Group

signatures.comment: Apply this group as a matrix and calculate matrix addition.

parameters.name: g
parameters.comment: a scalar number, an array of numeric arrays, or a group of Pt

signatures.comment: Apply this group as a matrix and calculate matrix multiplication.
signatures.returns_comment: If not elementwise, this will return a new  Group with M Pt, each with N dimensions (M-rows, N-columns).

parameters.name: g
parameters.comment: a scalar number, an array of numeric arrays, or a Group of K Pts, each with N dimensions (K-rows, N-columns) -- or if transposed is true, then N Pts with K dimensions

parameters.name: transposed
parameters.comment: (Only applicable if it's not elementwise multiplication) If true, then a and b's columns should match (ie, each Pt should have the same dimensions). Default is `false`.

parameters.name: elementwise
parameters.comment: if true, then the multiplication is done element-wise. Default is `false`.

parameters.name: defaultValue
parameters.comment: a default value to fill if index out of bound. If not provided, it will throw an error instead.

parameters.name: useLongest
parameters.comment: If true, find the longest list of values in a Pt and use its length for zipping. Default is false, which uses the first item's length for zipping.

signatures.comment: Iterator

Returns an object whose properties have the value 'true'
when they will be absent when used in a 'with' statement.
signatures.returns: { copyWithin:`boolean`, entries:`boolean`, fill:`boolean`, find:`boolean`, findIndex:`boolean`, keys:`boolean`, values:`boolean` }

signatures.comment: Add scalar or vector values to this group's Pts.

parameters.name: args
parameters.comment: can be either a list of numbers, an array, a Pt, or an object with {x,y,z,w} properties

signatures.comment: Anchor all the Pts in this Group by its absolute position from a target Pt. (ie, add all Pt with the target anchor to get an absolute position).  All the Pts' values will be updated.

parameters.name: ptOrIndex
parameters.comment: a Pt, or a numeric index to target a specific Pt in this Group

signatures.comment: Anchor all the Pts in this Group using a target Pt as origin. (ie, subtract all Pt with the target anchor to get a relative position). All the Pts' values will be updated.

parameters.name: ptOrIndex
parameters.comment: a Pt, or a numeric index to target a specific Pt in this Group

signatures.comment: Find the rectangular bounding box of this group's Pts.
signatures.returns_comment: a Group of 2 Pts representing the top-left and bottom-right of the rectangle

signatures.comment: Find the centroid of this group's Pts, which is the average middle point.
Depp clone this group and its Pts.

Combines two or more arrays.
This method returns a new array without modifying any existing arrays.

parameters.name: items
parameters.comment: Additional arrays and/or items to add to the end of the array.

signatures.comment:
Combines two or more arrays.
This method returns a new array without modifying any existing arrays.

parameters.name: items
parameters.comment: Additional arrays and/or items to add to the end of the array.

signatures.comment:
Returns the this object after copying a section of the array identified by start and end
to the same array starting at position target

parameters.name: target
parameters.comment:
If target is negative, it is treated as length+target where length is the
length of the array.

parameters.name: start
parameters.comment:
If start is negative, it is treated as length+start. If end is negative, it
is treated as length+end.

parameters.name: end
parameters.comment: If not specified, length of the this object is used as its default value.

signatures.comment: Divide this group's Pts over scalar or vector values (as element-wise).

parameters.name: args
parameters.comment: can be either a list of numbers, an array, a Pt, or an object with {x,y,z,w} properties

signatures.comment: Returns an iterable of key, value pairs for every entry in the array
Determines whether all the members of an array satisfy the specified test.

parameters.name: predicate
parameters.comment:
A function that accepts up to three arguments. The every method calls
the predicate function for each element in the array until the predicate returns a value
which is coercible to the Boolean value false, or until the end of the array.

parameters.name: thisArg
parameters.comment:
An object to which the this keyword can refer in the predicate function.
If thisArg is omitted, undefined is used as the this value.

signatures.comment: Determines whether all the members of an array satisfy the specified test.

parameters.name: predicate
parameters.comment:
A function that accepts up to three arguments. The every method calls
the predicate function for each element in the array until the predicate returns a value
which is coercible to the Boolean value false, or until the end of the array.

parameters.name: thisArg
parameters.comment:
An object to which the this keyword can refer in the predicate function.
If thisArg is omitted, undefined is used as the this value.

signatures.comment: Changes all array elements from `start` to `end` index to a static `value` and returns the modified array

parameters.name: value
parameters.comment: value to fill array section with

parameters.name: start
parameters.comment:
index to start filling the array at. If start is negative, it is treated as
length+start where length is the length of the array.

parameters.name: end
parameters.comment:
index to stop filling the array at. If end is negative, it is treated as
length+end.

signatures.comment: Returns the elements of an array that meet the condition specified in a callback function.

parameters.name: predicate
parameters.comment: A function that accepts up to three arguments. The filter method calls the predicate function one time for each element in the array.

parameters.name: thisArg
parameters.comment: An object to which the this keyword can refer in the predicate function. If thisArg is omitted, undefined is used as the this value.

signatures.comment: Returns the elements of an array that meet the condition specified in a callback function.

parameters.name: predicate
parameters.comment: A function that accepts up to three arguments. The filter method calls the predicate function one time for each element in the array.

parameters.name: thisArg
parameters.comment: An object to which the this keyword can refer in the predicate function. If thisArg is omitted, undefined is used as the this value.

signatures.comment:
Returns the value of the first element in the array where predicate is true, and undefined
otherwise.

parameters.name: predicate
parameters.comment:
find calls predicate once for each element of the array, in ascending
order, until it finds one where predicate returns true. If such an element is found, find
immediately returns that element value. Otherwise, find returns undefined.

parameters.name: thisArg
parameters.comment:
If provided, it will be used as the this value for each invocation of
predicate. If it is not provided, undefined is used instead.

signatures.comment:
Returns the index of the first element in the array where predicate is true, and -1
otherwise.

parameters.name: predicate
parameters.comment:
find calls predicate once for each element of the array, in ascending
order, until it finds one where predicate returns true. If such an element is found,
findIndex immediately returns that element index. Otherwise, findIndex returns -1.

parameters.name: thisArg
parameters.comment:
If provided, it will be used as the this value for each invocation of
predicate. If it is not provided, undefined is used instead.

signatures.comment: Performs the specified action for each element in an array.

parameters.name: callbackfn
parameters.comment: A function that accepts up to three arguments. forEach calls the callbackfn function one time for each element in the array.

parameters.name: thisArg
parameters.comment: An object to which the this keyword can refer in the callbackfn function. If thisArg is omitted, undefined is used as the this value.

signatures.comment: Update each Pt in this Group with an existing Pt function.

parameters.name: ptFn
parameters.comment: string name of an existing Pt function. Note that the function must return Pt.

parameters.name: args
parameters.comment: arguments for the function specified in ptFn

signatures.comment: Determines whether an array includes a certain element, returning true or false as appropriate.

parameters.name: searchElement
parameters.comment: The element to search for.

parameters.name: fromIndex
parameters.comment: The position in this array at which to begin searching for searchElement.

signatures.comment: Returns the index of the first occurrence of a value in an array, or -1 if it is not present.

parameters.name: searchElement
parameters.comment: The value to locate in the array.

parameters.name: fromIndex
parameters.comment: The array index at which to begin the search. If fromIndex is omitted, the search starts at index 0.

signatures.comment: Insert more Pt into this group.

parameters.name: pts
parameters.comment: a Group or an Iterable<Pt>

parameters.name: index
parameters.comment: the index position to insert into

signatures.comment: Get an interpolated point on the line segments defined by this Group.

parameters.name: t
parameters.comment: a value between 0 to 1 usually

signatures.comment: Adds all the elements of an array into a string, separated by the specified separator string.

parameters.name: separator
parameters.comment: A string used to separate one element of the array from the next in the resulting string. If omitted, the array elements are separated with a comma.

signatures.comment: Returns an iterable of keys in the array
Returns the index of the last occurrence of a specified value in an array, or -1 if it is not present.

parameters.name: searchElement
parameters.comment: The value to locate in the array.

parameters.name: fromIndex
parameters.comment: The array index at which to begin searching backward. If fromIndex is omitted, the search starts at the last index in the array.

signatures.comment: Get all the line segments (ie, edges in a graph) of this group.
Calls a defined callback function on each element of an array, and returns an array that contains the results.

parameters.name: callbackfn
parameters.comment: A function that accepts up to three arguments. The map method calls the callbackfn function one time for each element in the array.

parameters.name: thisArg
parameters.comment: An object to which the this keyword can refer in the callbackfn function. If thisArg is omitted, undefined is used as the this value.

signatures.comment: Move every Pt's position by a specific amount. Same as [`Group.add`](#link).

parameters.name: args
parameters.comment: can be either a list of numbers, an array, a Pt, or an object with {x,y,z,w} properties

signatures.comment: Move the first Pt in this group to a specific position, and move all the other Pts correspondingly.

parameters.name: args
parameters.comment: can be either a list of numbers, an array, a Pt, or an object with {x,y,z,w} properties

signatures.comment: Multiply scalar or vector values (as element-wise) with this group's Pts.

parameters.name: args
parameters.comment: can be either a list of numbers, an array, a Pt, or an object with {x,y,z,w} properties

signatures.comment: Create an operation using this Group, passing this Group into a custom function's first parameter.  See the [Op guide](../guide/Op-0400.html) for details.
signatures.returns_comment: a resulting function that takes other parameters required in `fn`

parameters.name: fn
parameters.comment: any function that takes a Group as its first parameter

tags.text: `let myOp = group.op( fn ); let result = myOp( [1,2,3] );`

signatures.comment: This combines a series of operations into an array. See the [Op guide](../guide/Op-0400.html) for details.

parameters.name: fns
parameters.comment: an array of functions for `op`

tags.text: `let myOps = pt.ops([fn1, fn2, fn3]); let results = myOps.map( (op) => op([1,2,3]) );`

signatures.comment:
Removes the last element from an array and returns it.
If the array is empty, undefined is returned and the array is not modified.
Appends new elements to the end of an array, and returns the new length of the array.

parameters.name: items
parameters.comment: New elements to add to the array.

signatures.comment: Calls the specified callback function for all the elements in an array. The return value of the callback function is the accumulated result, and is provided as an argument in the next call to the callback function.

parameters.name: callbackfn
parameters.comment: A function that accepts up to four arguments. The reduce method calls the callbackfn function one time for each element in the array.

signatures.comment: Calls the specified callback function for all the elements in an array. The return value of the callback function is the accumulated result, and is provided as an argument in the next call to the callback function.

parameters.name: callbackfn
parameters.comment: A function that accepts up to four arguments. The reduce method calls the callbackfn function one time for each element in the array.

parameters.name: initialValue
parameters.comment: If initialValue is specified, it is used as the initial value to start the accumulation. The first call to the callbackfn function provides this value as an argument instead of an array value.

signatures.comment: Calls the specified callback function for all the elements in an array, in descending order. The return value of the callback function is the accumulated result, and is provided as an argument in the next call to the callback function.

parameters.name: callbackfn
parameters.comment: A function that accepts up to four arguments. The reduceRight method calls the callbackfn function one time for each element in the array.

signatures.comment: Calls the specified callback function for all the elements in an array, in descending order. The return value of the callback function is the accumulated result, and is provided as an argument in the next call to the callback function.

parameters.name: callbackfn
parameters.comment: A function that accepts up to four arguments. The reduceRight method calls the callbackfn function one time for each element in the array.

parameters.name: initialValue
parameters.comment: If initialValue is specified, it is used as the initial value to start the accumulation. The first call to the callbackfn function provides this value as an argument instead of an array value.

signatures.comment: Reflect this group's Pts along a 2D line. Default anchor point is the first Pt in this group.

parameters.name: line
parameters.comment: a Group or an Iterable<PtLike> with 2 Pt that defines a line for reflection

parameters.name: axis
parameters.comment: optional axis such as "yz" to define a 2D plane of reflection

signatures.comment: Like Array's splice function, with support for negative index and a friendlier name.

parameters.name: index
parameters.comment: start index, which can be negative (where -1 is at index 0, -2 at index 1, etc)

parameters.name: count
parameters.comment: number of items to remove

signatures.comment:
Reverses the elements in an array in place.
This method mutates the array and returns a reference to the same array.
Rotate this group's Pt from an anchor point in 2D. Default anchor point is the first Pt in this group.

parameters.name: angle
parameters.comment: rotate angle

parameters.name: anchor
parameters.comment: optional anchor point to scale from

parameters.name: axis
parameters.comment: optional string such as "yz" to specify a 2D plane

signatures.comment: Scale this group's Pts from an anchor point. Default anchor point is the first Pt in this group.

parameters.name: scale
parameters.comment: scale ratio

parameters.name: anchor
parameters.comment: optional anchor point to scale from

signatures.comment: Split this group into an array of sub-group segments.

parameters.name: pts_per_segment
parameters.comment: number of Pts in each segment

parameters.name: stride
parameters.comment: forward-step to take

parameters.name: loopBack
parameters.comment: if `true`, always go through the array till the end and loop back to the beginning to complete the segments if needed

signatures.comment: Shear this group's Pt from an anchor point in 2D. Default anchor point is the first Pt in this group.

parameters.name: anchor
parameters.comment: optional anchor point to scale from

parameters.name: axis
parameters.comment: optional string such as "yz" to specify a 2D plane

signatures.comment:
Removes the first element from an array and returns it.
If the array is empty, undefined is returned and the array is not modified.

Returns a copy of a section of an array.
For both start and end, a negative index can be used to indicate an offset from the end of the array.
For example, -2 refers to the second to last element of the array.

parameters.name: start
parameters.comment:
The beginning index of the specified portion of the array.
If start is undefined, then the slice begins at index 0.

parameters.name: end
parameters.comment:
The end index of the specified portion of the array. This is exclusive of the element at the index 'end'.
If end is undefined, then the slice extends to the end of the array.

signatures.comment: Determines whether the specified callback function returns true for any element of an array.

parameters.name: predicate
parameters.comment:
A function that accepts up to three arguments. The some method calls
the predicate function for each element in the array until the predicate returns a value
which is coercible to the Boolean value true, or until the end of the array.

parameters.name: thisArg
parameters.comment:
An object to which the this keyword can refer in the predicate function.
If thisArg is omitted, undefined is used as the this value.

signatures.comment:
Sorts an array in place.
This method mutates the array and returns a reference to the same array.

parameters.name: compareFn
parameters.comment:
Function used to determine the order of the elements. It is expected to return
a negative value if the first argument is less than the second argument, zero if they're equal, and a positive
value otherwise. If omitted, the elements are sorted in ascending, ASCII character order.
```ts
[11,2,22,1].sort((a, b) => a - b)
```

signatures.comment: Sort this group's Pts by values in a specific dimension.

parameters.name: dim
parameters.comment: dimensional index

parameters.name: desc
parameters.comment: if true, sort descending. Default is false (ascending)

signatures.comment: Removes elements from an array and, if necessary, inserts new elements in their place, returning the deleted elements.
signatures.returns_comment: An array containing the elements that were deleted.

parameters.name: start
parameters.comment: The zero-based location in the array from which to start removing elements.

parameters.name: deleteCount
parameters.comment: The number of elements to remove.

signatures.comment: Removes elements from an array and, if necessary, inserts new elements in their place, returning the deleted elements.
signatures.returns_comment: An array containing the elements that were deleted.

parameters.name: start
parameters.comment: The zero-based location in the array from which to start removing elements.

parameters.name: deleteCount
parameters.comment: The number of elements to remove.

parameters.name: items
parameters.comment: Elements to insert into the array in place of the deleted elements.

signatures.comment: Split this Group into an array of sub-groups.

parameters.name: chunkSize
parameters.comment: number of items per sub-group

parameters.name: stride
parameters.comment: forward-steps after each sub-group

parameters.name: loopBack
parameters.comment: if `true`, always go through the array till the end and loop back to the beginning to complete the segments if needed

signatures.comment: Subtract scalar or vector values from this group's Pts.

parameters.name: args
parameters.comment: can be either a list of numbers, an array, a Pt, or an object with {x,y,z,w} properties

signatures.comment: Get a Bound instance of this group
Returns a string representation of an array. The elements are converted to string using their toLocaleString methods.
Get a string representation of this group.
Inserts new elements at the start of an array, and returns the new length of the array.

parameters.name: items
parameters.comment: Elements to insert at the start of the array.

signatures.comment: Returns an iterable of values in the array
Zip one slice of an array of Pt. Imagine the Pts are organized in rows, then this function will take the values in a specific column.

parameters.name: defaultValue
parameters.comment: a default value to fill if index out of bound. If not provided, it will throw an error instead.

signatures.comment: Convert an array of numeric arrays into a Group.

parameters.name: list
parameters.comment: an Iterable<PtLike> such as an array or a generator (of PtLike numeric arrays)

signatures.comment: Convert an Array/Iterable of Pt into a Group.

parameters.name: list
parameters.comment: an Iterable<Pt>

properties.name: length
properties.comment: Gets or sets the length of the array. This is a number one higher than the highest index in the array.
